reference_summary:
ER: The Complete Seasons 1-15 [DVD]
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Drama
['ER:The Complete Seasons One-Fifteen (15pk/GFT/DVD)', "ER explores the inner workings of an urban teaching hospital and critical issues faced by the dedicated physicians and staff of its emergency room. The pulse-pounding drama features new challenges each season, from exploring personal problems outside of Chicago's County General Hospital to the political issues being raised inside. Each season features new additions, including chief resident Kerry Weaver, Alex Kingston as British surgeon Elizabeth Corday, Paul McCrane as abrasive Dr. Robert Romano, and Lucy Knight (Kellie Martin), a third-year medical student starting her rotation. It’s always rush hour at Chicago’s County General where every day brings triumphs and losses. As Dr. Greene fights his final battle, his former student, John Carter, must step in as Chief Resident to lead the group of healers. Meanwhile, Kovac’s wild ways begin to affect his job performance, Susan Lewis gets married, and Weaver gets promoted. Plus, Carter and Kovac return from their time in Africa.", ']]>']
{'Genre': 'Drama, Television', 'Format': 'Box set, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Various', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Number Of Discs': '90', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 9.05 Pounds', 'Item model number': '883929221660', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Box set, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Release date': 'September 13, 2011', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Dubbed': 'Portuguese', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '90'}
Loved the show when it was on TV and I still love it.  I am hearing impaired and missed a lot of dialog when it was on so I was looking forward to watching these with the captioning.  Many of the seasons do not have this option.  It's great to watch without commercials!  With so little to watch on TV these days, this has been a real treat for me.  I just wish the captioning wasn't missing on so many seasons.
Captions for Hearing Impaired are missing on some.
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Daniel Petrie'], 'Producers': ['David W. Rintels'], 'Starring': ['Jeff Fahey', 'Morgan Freeman', 'Laurie Metcalf'], 'Studio': ['Fisher Klingenstein Films']}
This was a very good movie, however I found it a bit slow moving in parts.  The acting was very good and I'm a huge fan of Morgan Freeman.  His part in this movie didn't seem to be awesome; it wasn't him - it was the part!  Not enough punch for me.  He's capable of so much more but the opportunity to give more wasn't there.
OK, but I expected more.
The Ghost and the Darkness
Michael Douglas  (Actor),     Val Kilmer  (Actor),     Stephen Hopkins  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
['Product Description', "Only the most incredible parts of the story are true. Michael Douglas and Val Kilmer star in this tense, terrific and true adventure set in 1896 East Africa. There, two lions on man-eating rampage have shut down the construction of a railway. The beasts hunt together, showing no fear of man or fire. What's more, they're killing for sport rather than for food-and they have an almost supernatural knack for knowing what traps await them. Big-game hunter Remington (Douglas) and construction engineer Patterson (Kilmer) set out to stop these unstoppable monsters. But, in this astonishing tale of man against beast, the hunters become the hunted.", 'Amazon.com', "Val Kilmer stars as Lt. Col. John Patterson, a 19th-century Irish engineer drafted by Britain's railroad bosses to build a trestle bridge over an African river, thus expanding the empire a tiny bit more. In Tsavo, Patterson is instantly hailed for killing a man-eating lion that had been making life hell for native workers. But morale sinks when a pair of unstoppable big cats devour more men and destroy the project. Along comes an Ahab-like, expatriate American hunter (Michael Douglas) to help Patterson face the almost preternatural powers of the two killers. The script by William Goldman (", 'Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid', ') is based on fact, though the film owes more to Spielberg (specifically to', 'Jaws', ') than history. There are also suggestive echoes of Kipling and Conrad in the material and characters, and there are hints of emotional complexity and psychological nuance that make one wish this could have been a great film instead of a merely fun one.', '--Tom Keogh']

Great (older) movie.  Great effects for the time it was made.  Beautiful country in the background.
A must see movie.

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference**: The user enjoys a blend of drama series and films, particularly those with action and adventure elements that prioritize character-driven narratives. Their appreciation for older films is evident, valuing aspects such as special effects and scenic backgrounds, while also embracing family-friendly cinema.

- **Format Preference**: DVD boxed sets remain their favorite format for an immersive viewing experience, with a strong emphasis on content that offers closed-captioning to meet their accessibility needs.

- **Accessibility Needs**: The user's hearing impairment significantly influences their viewing choices, leading them to seek films with accurate captioning and subtitles for optimal comprehension and enjoyment.

- **Viewing Habits**: They prefer commercial-free, uninterrupted viewing experiences, which complement their binge-watching tendencies. The user demonstrates a keen interest in engaging storylines that explore emotional depth and character development.

- **Nostalgic Viewer**: A strong emotional connection to past television and film experiences guides their content selections, with nostalgia playing a vital role.

- **Critical Engagement**: The user consistently provides thoughtful reviews, highlighting accessibility features and character opportunities, showcasing a commitment to inclusive media. Their recent feedback indicates a particular appreciation for family-oriented films, reinforcing their interest in content that resonates emotionally while remaining accessible.

Overall, the user remains an avid fan of character-rich dramas and action films, actively seeking content that balances emotional resonance with accessible viewing options, and favorably reviewing works that align with their nostalgic and critical viewpoints.
